Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Annotation Types
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.powermock.api.easymock.powermocklistener.AnnotationEnabler
    Test Runners uses an annotation enabling listener per default since version 1.3. You should just remove this listener.
    org.powermock.api.mockito.powermocklistener.AnnotationEnabler
    Test Runners uses an annotation enabling listener per default since version 1.3. You should just remove this listener.
  • Deprecated Annotation Types 
    Annotation Type and Description
    org.powermock.core.classloader.annotations.Mock
    Use Mock annotation in respective extension API instead. This annotation will be removed in an upcoming release.
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    org.powermock.mockpolicies.MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.addSubtituteReturnValue(Method, Object)
    Use MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.stubMethod(Method, Object) instead.
    org.powermock.api.support.membermodification.strategy.MethodStubStrategy.andReturn(T)
    Since version 1.4.1, use MethodStubStrategy.toReturn(Object) instead.
    org.powermock.api.support.membermodification.strategy.impl.MethodStubStrategyImpl.andReturn(T)
    org.powermock.reflect.Whitebox.getInternalState(Object, String, Class, Class)
    Use Whitebox.getInternalState(Object, String, Class) instead.
    org.powermock.mockpolicies.MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.getSubstituteReturnValues()
    Use MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.getStubbedMethods() instead.
    org.powermock.mockpolicies.MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.setSubtituteReturnValues(Map)
    Use MockPolicyInterceptionSettings.stubMethod(Method, Object) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressConstructor(Class...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Constructor[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressConstructor(Class, boolean)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Constructor[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressConstructor(Constructor...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Constructor[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressField(Class[])
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Field[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressField(Class, String...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Field) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressField(Field...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Field[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class[])
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class, boolean)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class, Class...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class, String[])
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class, String, Class[])
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Class, String, String...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressMethod(Method...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Method[]) instead.
    org.powermock.api.easymock.PowerMock.suppressSpecificConstructor(Class, Class...)
    Use MemberModifier.suppress(Constructor) instead.
